intro: Psorospermum emarginatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved psorospermum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, simple leaves with a distinctive notched or emarginate base. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
